website_summaries.verdict: All-black glove looks sharp. Extra deep pocket makes it easier to play defense after delivering the pitch.
pros: Perfect size of glove for younger and older pitchers alike at 11.75 inches
Glove contains an extra long pocket, so you can keep the ball hidden from the batter while you receive the sign from the catcher and adjust your grip for the called pitch
Soft materials used in the glove make it easier to break in
Will work well for infielders, too
cons: Costs a little more than some other options, so it may not be the best investment for a young player who's just starting to pitch

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to play catch with my kids (9 years old) and while coaching their baseball and softball teams. Leather is good quality for the price range. It will be a little stiff when you get it, but put some oil on it and play catch and it breaks in quickly. A nice improvement over my previous glove. I think it'll only get better with time as it continues to soften and break-in.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super Glove for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this glove for my little leaguer and am very pleased with the fit and finish. The big difference in gloves really seems to be in the quality of the materials used. This glove has the thick, high quality leather and construction that the expensive (+$100) gloves in the big boxes. Great find.
customer_reviews.author: Wawro Family

customer_reviews.title: Nice Leather glove. Made in Phillippines
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 9th birthday present. Fits perfect and was usable (not field ready, but not stiff as a board) right out of the box. Couldn't be happier for the price. Nice leather glove. I saw some discussion on where they are made. This one's tag said Philippines which is what it is. I will probably make sure his forever glove is USA made. I bought some nokuma glove conditioner for it and its in great shape now.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the investment.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this glove based on my previous glove from the same product line. I have a 12.75 that I use in the outfield and have for the last 4 years. Has held up to multiple seasons and when I needed a new infield glove I went with the line I know and the price was right. This one will be my 2ne/3rd base glove. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: William Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Too small for my adult hands
customer_reviews.text: This glove feels like a kids glove. It's way too small for me. I'm just a normal sized adult male. It's too tight on my hand and too small to comfortably catch balls. I gave it to my 12 year old daughter and it seems to fit her OK.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, received a different glove than the one pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Really great glove for the price. Paid $50 and its full grain leather. Only gripe is that the picture displayed a H web mitt and the one they arrived is a basket weave. I was disappointed that the glove I received was different from the one picture. With that, it's a great glove and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this as a game glove. What I mean by that is simple catch here and there and to bring to professional baseball games for foul balls. This glove came in decently broken in. I am glad I bought it and stuck with Rawlings. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ringer127

customer_reviews.title: Rawlings is the best
customer_reviews.text: Mitt is very nicely made and for the price is really a terrific buy. Getting a medium adult male hand to it is a little tough... but once in, it is fine. Out of the box it needs about 25-30% break in. Overall, good purchase. I love Rawlings gloves and mitts....for over 60 years now!
customer_reviews.author: Marcella

customer_reviews.title: Good glove for a middle schooler playing little league
customer_reviews.text: Good glove for a middle schooler playing little league. Smaller pocket than some but I like that, teaches kids how to properly field a ball and not so clunky. Size of glove probably good through middle school, after that, you'll probably need to go to a larger one...
customer_reviews.author: theunartistTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this glove. Doesn't take as much time to break in and he was able to use it after practicing with it for a short time. Great size for little league and pony league. Used for second base and shortstop and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo Segretto

customer_reviews.title: and is perfect for a 9-12 year old
customer_reviews.text: This glove works well, is already mostly broken in, and is perfect for a 9-12 year old. It is 11.25, so it is primarily for infielders and pitchers. If you have a large hand, it may feel too small for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Glove is genuinely premium
customer_reviews.text: I bought this glove for my 10 year old son and it worked in very well. We've purchased at least 8 all-leather gloves for son or daughter over the years and this one is obviously superior to previous ones. The leather has more flexibility and substance in the grain. The pocket design is smart and more ergonomic than those in previous purchases. It also broke in quite quickly. It truly is a premium glove.
customer_reviews.author: John Wight

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on sail. But if you plan on playing some hard pass, this glove will probably leave you with a nice bruise in your palm. Besides that, it’s pretty comfy.
customer_reviews.author: melvin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect infield glove ages 10-12
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised by the high quality of this glove. With the price, you can't beat it. Perfect infield glove ages 10-12.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Russell

customer_reviews.title: my son says that it is little stiff and not as comfortable. May be it needs little more breaking time
customer_reviews.text: we use it for drills and practice only , my son says that it is little stiff and not as comfortable. May be it needs little more breaking time.
customer_reviews.author: Arun Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Great glove!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know much about baseball or baseball gloves but from the research that I did, this was an affordable glove that functions well.
customer_reviews.author: Zhongyue

customer_reviews.title: Different glove pictured
customer_reviews.text: Nice glove but the picture on this product shows a basket style pocket. The actual glove received is the trapeze style. I am returning it as I don't like trapeze style.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McBride

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Son loved his glove. Only problem is his son wants one. Good seller
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyBoyz

customer_reviews.title: Heckuva glove for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Really good glove for the $$. Fit is really great and pocket is deep and really traps the ball.
customer_reviews.author: lloyd c. furgason

customer_reviews.title: Ordered from Japan
customer_reviews.text: Ordered from Japan. Although it is written that this glove can be used for both infielder and outfielder, the glove is a little small as an adult outfielder glove. So, if you are an outfielder, you'd better order 13 inch. The lether is much better than my expectation. 80% factory break-in helped me to use this glove at an actual game.
customer_reviews.author: Arihiro Y.

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice glove but it is NOT a right hand glove ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice glove but it is NOT a right hand glove - it is for a right-handed person.
customer_reviews.author: jalith

customer_reviews.title: Stellar Glove
customer_reviews.text: Excellant glove as expected from Rawlings. It took about 400 throws to break in. I do not use any glove oil, saddle soap, shaving cream, etc. I just simply played alot of catch with it. My 12 yr old son uses it and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 11 year old grandson - he was so excited when he unwrapped it!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality glove by Rawlings. Would recommend it, just make sure you get the right size/inches.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Danite

customer_reviews.title: Not for pepper!
customer_reviews.text: Plays shorter than 11 1/2. Does come fairly broken in, but basket web not great at retaining ball - actually very poor. I wouldn't trust it as anything more than a glove to take to a ballgame that you don't mind spilling a drink on. Definitely not good enough to play short or long toss with my son (freshman trying to walk on to a D1 program)! Ouch!!! Luckily I have a Nokona also. Note: if it doesn't take much work to break in, it probably won't hold up to intense play, or even pepper.
customer_reviews.author: Aggieboneman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The teenager I bought it for loves it and is playing high school baseball with it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Nice mit, but I did not receive the glove ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice mit, but I did not receive the glove that was pictured. I expected a open or closed web like the discriotion said but not the style i received. Glove is good quality and works well still.
customer_reviews.author: DCO

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this glove, both my boy and I use it...the leather is sturdy and easy to break in...
customer_reviews.author: Chuy

customer_reviews.title: Product not as described.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the Premium Pro Series 12" model, received the Youth model. Way to small for an adult hand.
customer_reviews.author: DPC

customer_reviews.title: Good quality! This glove is for my 13 year ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality! This glove is for my 13 year old son. He loves the glove. Will use to play on Middle school team.
customer_reviews.author: Humberto

customer_reviews.title: Quality that won't break the bank
customer_reviews.text: Great quality at a great price. Perfect for 8 yr old son - smaller hand opening.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Will field many outs!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this glove to break-in and give to one of our lesser equipped 10U players. Very pleased w/ the appearance and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: The leather feels good - supple but tough
customer_reviews.text: The glove is a little tight on my hand, but I have big hands and chose not to get one with an adjustable strap. The leather feels good - supple but tough, even if the palm leather is thin. If you like to catch in the palm, rather than the pocket, you might want to find a glove with more palm padding. Flexible enough to use right away, but does require some break-in to be fully ready for a game.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good glove worked great for coaching my sons baseball team
customer_reviews.author: farmer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got 12 3/4
customer_reviews.text: Glad I got 12 3/4, apparently Rawlings run small. Other than that it's a good quality glove. Just order about a half in bigger than what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Domingues

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great glove for the money. Easy break in and felt great right out of the box. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Knightly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves fits
customer_reviews.text: Got this glove yesterday, and used it today! Awesome gloves fits perfect
customer_reviews.author: Sean King

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be made of quality leather and has good padding in the palm and fingers
customer_reviews.text: I'm an adult male (6ft, 220 pounds) with average/large hands and it fit perfectly. It seems to be made of quality leather and has good padding in the palm and fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Wrong glove shown. Does not match picture. Also it's small compared to my other 12"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It fit perfectly for my 12 year old. We were able to break it in quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cantone

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not as good.
customer_reviews.text: The old GG Gamer was an incredible value. And a great glove. This glove as a replacement disappoints.
customer_reviews.author: Brent S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 10U travel team. Glove will likely last for a couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B

customer_reviews.title: what he didn't like about it was no strap
customer_reviews.text: This glove fit my son, what he didn't like about it was no strap. His,current glove had a strap over his hand to tighten or loosen...this didn't have which made it a little loose on his hand. He is 12.
customer_reviews.author: jenn Reco

customer_reviews.title: This was a very good glove for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a HS baseball coach and needed a new glove but didn't want to spend a lot of money since I only use it when I throw BP or play catch. This was a very good glove for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Largent

customer_reviews.title: Seller needs to do their homework
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. It was the wrong webbing and the wrong hand for my kid.
customer_reviews.author: TrackTrizzlean

customer_reviews.title: Also said it was a 12" but looks more like a 11
customer_reviews.text: Glove that was pictured was an H web. Glove I got was a basket web. This isn't what I ordered so I'm returning it. Also said it was a 12" but looks more like a 11. Glove quality is good for price just disappointed with the web I received.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, reasonably priced for rec league softball
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to this after the strings snapped on a much cheaper Rawlings glove (Rawlings Playmaker) I had bought in 2013. Padding, control, fit are all significantly better (as one would hope for a 60 vs 30 dollar glove). The glove came slightly broken in (as seems to be the norm for gloves at this price point), and took about a game or two to truly be broken in. I'd say it's definitely a safe bet for a rec league player.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Hall

customer_reviews.title: Wrong glove delivered
customer_reviews.text: We received the glove pictured in the first image. I thought I ordered the glove in the second image. I am sure the glove we received today will be great, but disappointing nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Barmann

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: This glove was damn near ready to use right out of the box. I spent a few hours oiling it up and working it over and it was game ready by the first game of the season. It was shipped and delivered early too. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Stover

customer_reviews.title: I got a 11 3/4 and the glove feels and looks like a 11
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY THIS GLOVE. First off they sent me the wrong webbing. Second, I got a 11 3/4 and the glove feels and looks like a 11. These gloves run SO SMALL. I don't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Julio

customer_reviews.title: he was very pleased. Come on spring
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my son's top three picks. He loves the color. Once it arrived, he was very pleased. Come on spring!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was more like a 12
customer_reviews.text: It was more like a 12.25 inch glove instead of the 12.5 inch I ordered. It says 12.5, but when compared to my friends gloves it is a 12.25 other than that it is a pretty good glove.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent glove. My son received his at Christmas and ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent glove. My son received his at Christmas and within a few weeks of just playing catch was game ready.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Ford

customer_reviews.title: for 60 dollars its one of the best purchases Ive made
customer_reviews.text: Its not an MLB glove. Yet, for 60 dollars its one of the best purchases Ive made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Wrong throwing hand, size and web pattern not even close to the one pictured
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best leather glove we found for the price
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, you might need to go back 30 years to find a really nice leather glove...that most people can afford. This one is good enough, its fine. But compared to my old glove purchased in the 1980's, this is a bit awkward. Better than this, I think you jump up $100.
customer_reviews.author: 4people2cats

customer_reviews.title: Wrong image as of March 2106 - Not an H web.
customer_reviews.text: Decent leather, seems small for a 12" glove but most troubling for me was that the picture showed an H web but the glove that shipped was a woven web. I really don't like woven webs. Eventually they break and they look like a little kids glove. So, if you're a little kid and you like a woven web this is probably a good glove for the money but if you're an adult and don't want to be made fun of, you should probably buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kennon McCaa

customer_reviews.title: My son loved the glove as soon as he put it on
customer_reviews.text: My son loved the glove as soon as he put it on! He is 10 years old and the glove fit his hand perfectly. It was easy to brake in too.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Scott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awsome glove once u brake it in your set for the season
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So/so
customer_reviews.text: Not satisfied . If your a highschool student this glove isn't the best. Get a heart of the hide the quality is way better. Although perfect glove if you're a begginer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: We'll made but not a true 12 1/2, runs very small.
customer_reviews.text: The glove is we'll made. The leather is pretty soft for a new glove. However, I'm very disappointed in the size. I have a similar Rawlings mit that is a 12 1/2 size and it's 2 1/2 inches bigger than this mitt. THIS IS NOT A MENS ADULT MITT! Unless you have unusually small hands and very small build, do not buy this for an male adult. Might fit a woman looking for a baseball mitt or for 14-16 year olds.
customer_reviews.author: AGar

customer_reviews.title: Amazing glove! At the age of 38 and with ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing glove! At the age of 38 and with 2 kids now big enough to start playing catch, I decided to buy myself a new glove, this Rawlings PPR1200, and I am so glad I did. It is very comfortable, the leather is great and quite soft so very fast to break-in, excellent construction and the price is a real bargain. You can't go wrong with that glove, 5 stars, no doubt about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Thomas de Voghel

product_meta.title: Rawlings Premium Pro Series Glove Series
product_meta.description: This premium Pro 1st base Premium Pro Series features single post double bar web, which gives it a stretchable web and forms a snug secure pocket which allows the ball to stick and not bounce. This glove also features a double ca-thud style which allows you to mold the end of the glove to scoop the ball. With its 12 1/2 inch pattern, this glove is designed only for the 1st base position. The solid core technology features opti-fit, an innovation designed to improve how the glove fits the hand, resulting in enhanced grip, maximum command and optimal feel. Matched with a lace-less heel, the one-piece palm construction revolutionizes the traditional way the glove is assembled, providing the player with ultimate control.
feature_bullets: Opt-fit Technology improves how the glove fits the hand
Lace-less heel and palm provide better feel for the ball and effortless break-in
Soft, full-grain leather shell for game-ready feel
Patented solid core Technology enhances "fit", "feel" and "function"
Right Hand Throw = Left Hand Glove, Left Hand Throw = Right Hand Glove
